ArticleTitle.sentence: A Bacterial Guanine Nucleotide Exchange Factor Activates ARF on Legionella Phagosomes

AbstractText.sentence: The intracellular pathogen Legionella pneumophila subverts vesicle traffic in eukaryotic host cells to create a vacuole that supports replication .
The dot/icm genes encode a protein secretion apparatus that L. pneumophila require for biogenesis of this vacuole .
Here we show that L. pneumophila produce a protein called RalF that functions as an exchange factor for the ADP ribosylation factor ( ARF ) family of guanosine triphosphatases ( GTPases ) .
The RalF protein is required for the localization of ARF on phagosomes containing L. pneumophila .
Translocation of RalF protein through the phagosomal membrane is a dot/ icm-dependent process .
Thus , RalF is a substrate of the Dot/Icm secretion apparatus .
